reviews.review: So I played this game when it first came out and I sincerely believe that it was better back then. I'm not even talking about the "dedicated servers" or "hit-boxes" that everyone so often complains about. Right now, issues like 4 survivors spawning right next to each other on a 2 sided map. In addition to this, currently I also see that the killer spawns very close to the survivors. In the past the community would complain that "survivors were broken" and it was "unfair to the killer." At this point in time, killers seem to have an edge. We as a community do NOT want to see one side stronger than the other, we want to see BALANCE. Furthermore, I've seen so many hook camping killers and not enough has been done to punish the killer in this aspect. Another issues that I've come across is not being able to find any games certain times during the 24 hour day. I can sit there for 30 minutes or even longer and I will not be able to find a lobby. On the flip side, we have received amazing content, I myself believe that it is overlooked due to the fact that there are many issues with this game. "Strangers things" was such a phenomenal inclusion into the game and it has left the community hungry for more. We could possibly expect our favourite characters/killers in this game in the future.

+ Game machanic is really nice, asymmetric playstyle brings a fresh taste to it.
+ Teamwork as a survivor really makes fun. Also escaping a chase. 
+ As Killer, the fun part is to screw with the survivors and drive them to a point where they make mistakes.

- Mostly bad balancing, few killers left who play the game
- Toxic survivors


Conclusion: Its fun, When you got a nice squad of survivors (friends for an example) and you can coordinate your actions.
As killer, the few times you aren't annoyed to death and have fun playing.. make it better. 

I'd recommend the purchase and go the hard way as killer, to understand the difficultly being one. Its like working in retail with a bunch of Karens. Then you cherish the game, and appreciate the opposing side.

Sounds strange? Well. its always 4v1 you do the math, and don't be scared shitless.

1 vs 4의 게임의 선두주자라고 할 수 있는게임
처음에는 생존자를 하는게 두려울 수 있겠지만
생존자야 말로 세상에서 가장 무서운 것을 알게될거임
밸런스가 잘 맞으면 재미가 있는데 매칭이 안 좋아서
제일 잘하는 고인물 1랭과 뉴비 20랭이 만나는 경우가 많음
그리고 퍽을 열려면 현질도 안되고 게임을 많이 해서 게임 화폐인 블러드 포인트를 모아야됨
고로 게임을 제대로 즐기려면 충분한 시간을 들여야 됨
뉴비입장에서는 없는 퍽으로 운영을 해야하니 힘들고
좀 플레이한 플레이어 입장에서는 뉴비때문에 게임이 터지니 답답함
무엇보다 다인큐로 인하여 살인마가 힘들어 지는 경우가 많음
그래서 진입장벽이 높음

Great game to play solo or with friends. 
The longer you play the better you get at reading peoples next move, those who have played longer you can usually tell by their ability to loop in which I love to use "mind games" to counter. 

Killer is my personal choice when playing but I still have a ton of fun screwing around with a survive with friends lobby. 
Overall its way more enjoyable then when I first started playing back at release, I'm glad I gave it a shot

Задумка нормальная, реализация сосёт, ненавижу эту игру всей душой, оптимизация на уровне черепахи, добавляются новые скины бесполезная хуйня, удалите ее со стима, верните мое время и деньги, разрабы идите нахуй вы конченые сука блять пидараса кусок.
这是个外服游戏，没有独立的国服的服务器，有些所谓口中的bug有时候是高延迟，高延迟带来的极差的体验，当然，bug存在！游戏不是一个人的游戏，爽的也不是一个人爽，只记得自己被溜爆，不记得自己爽过。出来混迟早要还的！个人觉得本来就是一个不公平非对抗游戏，如何平等？我觉得这就是最好的黎明杀机。我很开心，我乐意和人皇屠皇高手过招，这不光是无脑或者技巧，更多的是心态。

Honestly, one of my favorite games of all time. 

I like to consider myself part of the "Old Guard", I've been playing from the beta when this game was just an uncertain nugget of an idea, as it blossomed in a cataclysmic bloodweb of grassroots balance work when my love for horror saw licensed killers/survivors added. I've seen so many changes come in and out that honestly hopping back into it on PC hasn't been much of a stretch and the beauty of it all is that the core of the game stays so familiar even if the changes don't.

Forget Friday The 13th. Depth. Alien vs. Predator. Or if you want to trudge up some truly repressed memories, Evolve. This is the apex of 4v1 games as we've come to know them and as a player with over 400+ hrs between PC and consoles I still find myself terrified or thrilled depending on which side of the coin I'm on, whether running, screaming and hiding in plain sight like a 200IQ coward as a survivor or double pipping on a merciless 4k as The Huntress with hatchet snipes as a killer.

Enough of the good. Some of my biggest gripes lie with how others approach the game, not necessarily the game itself. It's sucks to take 10 minutes to find a match, find one and then the killer facecamps you on the hook till you die and you're back out again in the biggest waste of time ever. The disconnectors, who get salty and leave a match, robbing you of progression and MMR.

The cosmetics, back when I started weren't paid for, just unlocked as you play and I seriously miss that so much. 

The addition of Auric Cells begs me to have a bowl of bleach and Tide Pods for breakfast but otherwise still a fantastic package all around.
its a good game to play with your friends and by yourself. best of both worlds
Good time killer, literally lol but this game is fun, its a good fall back game. ( a game you could always come back to ) Super fun when you got a group of friends

The game is just completely unbalanced, the survivors have basically nothing going for them if they are beginners, and you will die like every game. However, if you're a beginner killer, you basically get a free win perk immediately. Also the community is extremely toxic. Even when I play killer, usually I'll try to be sort of nice to survivors and give them like one or 2 second chances if i can. Unfortunately this leads me to usually lose some games and get called shit by the same survivors. When I play survivor, I'll basically be camped on by a killer on my first hook and then get called shit too. The cycle of toxicity is just so annoying.

[strike]Alright, so after 300 hours I think I can finally have an opinion on the game.

Do I think this game is fun? Yes.

Do I recommend it? Yes. But...

The game has so many little issues that keep it from being great. I think that the core gameplay loop itself is very interesting and actually a lot of fun. The game pits a single killer against four survivors, the latter needing to repair generators and escape the trial, and the killer needing to stop the survivors and sacrifice them. However to start off, the game is riddled with bugs and glitches that range from being hilarious to being hands-down infuriating to encounter. There's been more than a couple times that I had been robbed of my life as a survivor or robbed of a hit as a killer because of a glitch or inconsistent hitboxes. 

Dead by Daylight is rife with toxic players and balancing issues. When it comes to the toxic community, I do not entirely place the blame on the devs, because that is something mostly out of their control. However, the game is built in a way that allows players to act like assholes and ruin the days of others, because of core issues that remain to be fixed or addressed. There is little to no penalty for killers camping, and some items are completely unfair or simply unfun to play against. This sort of ties into balance as well - the presence of these unfair perks or items can often foster toxic or unsportsman-like behavior. If powerful items exist, people will equip them and there is nothing that can be done about it if changes are not made.

Speaking about balance in a broader fashion, the game is not balanced. Both survivors and killers have what are known as "nuclear options". Either side can have item or perk "nuclear options" that have little to no counterplay and vastly overshadow other items. It's like if in a war, two armies are shooting at each other with arrows and then somebody suddenly decides to bring out a nuke and drop it on the opposing side. Balance does not come from both sides having access to nuclear options - all choices for both sides must be reasonable. There are only 4 killers that are viable in high ranks and only a dozen or so perks that are reliably powerful (for both killers and survivors). This means that the meta can be often stale, with survivors bringing the same 4 perks every game and people playing as the same 4 killers over and over again. The devs need to definitely step their game up and tweak the "nuclear" options while making everything else that isn't "meta" better. There is almost no reason not to stick to the same perks and/or characters every game, and literally everything else that isn't part of the meta looks like dog water in comparison.

Things to note: 
-Performance is decent, but some of the revamped maps cause a bit of lag.
-This game costs 20 dollars but it is monetized like a free-to-play game. The grind is real, and many of the good perks and killers are locked behind a paywall. However, there is a weekly rotation of perks for killer and survivor that you can buy from without spending real money, which is nice. The catch is, since there are so many perks available in the game and only a couple that are meta, it's difficult to rely on this.
-Some aspects of the game is based on RNG and luck, which isn't always a bad thing. Every map spawns a tiny bit differently every time you play, which makes things interesting, but it can also be annoying when your killer totem spawns in front of the survivors and you lose one of your abilities in 15 seconds as a result. Don't even get me started on how there are maps that are garbage for the killer, and maps that are completely the opposite. There's also one killer who is almost completely reliant on luck (the Trapper), and that's a bit of a balancing issue as well.
-Matchmaking is monkey food omfg
-It's way funner with friends. You can complain together instead of complaining to yourself!
-Movement feels good and the sound design is great. 
-There's characters from your favorite horror franchises, such as Michael Myers and Freddy Kreuger.
-The game still gets updated frequently, with new chapters coming out every 3-4 months. In these chapters usually come one killer and one survivor, each with three unique perks. New maps, map revamps, and balance changes are present each chapter as well.
-Feel free to correct me about anything in this review! My opinion is simply my opinion, and I could change my mind in the future about what I said!

Conclusion: The game has issues, but it's really fun (stressful though). I have a love/hate relationship with Dead by Daylight, and if you're into that kind of shit, definitely get this game ;-)

7.5/10[/strike]

Its fun but holy hell the player base can be toxic, on both sides! As others have said, I have a love/hate relationship with this game. On one hands, I can laugh manically while hacking at people and the other I get run down. And hooked, over and over and over again. 

If you like being frustrated or taking your anger out on toxic, teabagging heathens then this is the game for you.

I love and hate this game. I main survivor and enjoy playing solo or with family/friends. The dbd community is very awesome but can run into some players who are having a bad day. They added crossplay a while ago and that really brought in a lot of different skill set survivors and killers which I enjoy. The only thing that needs a redone is the rubber banding hits from certain killers. Ive tried to master palette drops in stunning killers but get really frustrated when a killer still hits you after finising a vault and a few steps from window or palette. Lithe is the only perk that has helped me with this problem but will wait patiently. gg
favorite game, so much replayability. Balancing is kinda wonky but very fun for solo or friends!

Really fun game to play with others on discord and offers the flexibility of custom games or a public lobby with randos so you can play with 1 friend or 4 friends. The game play is very unpredictable since it is real people and not computers you are playing against so it never gets boring. Sometimes some players can be toxic though. The one thing I don't like is that you MUST use discord to talk to others so you effectively can't communicate with randos other than hand gestures or chat after the game.
Game good, community is 50% nice 50% toxic, too many campers and tunnelers, but game is good
